title: (x) Text and cover type in Zadie Smith's "Changing My Mind" - Electra, Estilo, P22 Underground {Yves}
content:
I am reading this book by **Zadie Smith — Changing My Mind**  
and I would like to know what fonts are used for headlines and plain text within the book.

I hate it when they do not mention what fonts used in books... especially in well-made + designed books such as this.

okay here's the text within the book.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ZS-eight_5317.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ZS-monday_4553.png)
author: rosmedia

Hi Kay,  
your deep link is blocked by the hoster.  
It’s better to embed the image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lb_ChangingMyMind_5074.jpg)
ah.. okay THANX Florian
The rounded sans caps are [Estilo](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/super_families/estilo/).

‘Changing My Mind’ could be a sightly squooshed [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100008), no?  
‘Occasional Essays’, however, looks more like Futura.
The serif text face is [Electra](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/electra_std_complete_vp/).
"Changing my mind" is [P22 Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/p22/p22_underground_pro_full_set/).
‘Zadie Smith’ could be based on Gotham aswell – modified in a [Marian-Bantjes-inspired style](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635/http:/www.bantjes.com/index.php?id=216).
Ah, Underground! Yessss …

... as found in the [Gill Sans Alternatives](http://web.archive.org/web/20130623022635/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/alternatives/gill_sans/?&sample_text=CHANGING%20MY%20MIND&sample_size=24) FontList.
Why the heck didn’t they stick with Underground for ‘Occasional Essays’?

WOW!!

thanx for Estilo
